titleInfo.title: Coll 30/210(4) 'Bahrein Petroleum Company: Recruitment of women-stenographers.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence from the Ministry of Fuel and Power, Petroleum Division; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Political Agent, Bahrain, concerning a request from the Bahrain Petroleum Company (BAPCO) to recruit women stenographers in the United Kingdom: ten immediately, and seventy-five over the course of the following one to two years. The demand arose from the construction by the company of a 100 octane plant, and consequent increase in the amount of clerical work required. A telegram from the Political Resident dated 1 June 1945 describes the type of accommodation available for the women.The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
